***** Hindi[edit] *****
**** Etymology[edit] ****
From Prakrit किअउं (kiauṃ) and Sanskrit कृतं (kṛtaṃ) (perfect participle neuter
of कृ (kṛ, “to do”)).
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * (Delhi Hindi) IPA(key): /kiː/
Audio  (file)
**** Postposition[edit] ****
की • (kī) f (Urdu spelling کی‎)
   1. feminine of का (kā):
         1. of
         2. belonging to
                  राम की बेटी ― rām kī beṭī ― Ram's daughter
         3. concerning
         4. made of, consisting of
**** Verb[edit] ****
की • (kī) (Urdu spelling کی‎)
   1. inflection of करना (karnā):
         1. feminine singular perfective participle
         2. feminine singular perfect indicative
***** Marathi[edit] *****
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * IPA(key): /ki/, [kiː]
**** Etymology 1[edit] ****
Borrowed from Classical_Persian که‎ (ki). Compare Gujarati કે (ke), Hindi कि
(ki), Punjabi ਕਿ (ki) / کہ‎ (kh).
*** Conjunction[edit] ***
की • (kī)
   1. that
            मला माहीत नव्हते की तू मराठी बोलू शकतोस.
                  malā māhīt navhate kī tū marāṭhī bolū śaktos.
                  I didn't know that you speak Marathi
                  (literally, “I wasn't aware that you can speak Marathi.”)
**** Etymology 2[edit] ****
Inherited from Old_Marathi 𑘎𑘲𑘽 (kīṃ), from Maharastri_Prakrit 𑀓𑀺𑀁 (kiṃ), 𑀓𑀺
(ki), from Sanskrit किम् (kím, “what, which”). Compare Gujarati કિયું (kiyũ),
Hindi कि (ki), Punjabi ਕੀ (kī), Bengali কি (ki), Assamese কি (ki).
*** Particle[edit] ***
की • (kī)
   1. or
            Synonyms: अथवा (athvā), किंवा (kiuvā)

    * Berntsen, Maxine, “की”, in A Basic Marathi-English Dictionary, New Delhi:
      American Institute of Indian Studies, 1982-1983.
    * Molesworth,_James_Thomas (1857), “कीं”, inA dictionary, Marathi and
      English, Bombay: Printed for government at the Bombay Education Society's
      Press
    * Date, Yasavanta Ramakrshna (1932-1950), “कीं”, inMaharashtra Sabdakosa(in
      Marathi), Pune: Maharashtra Kosamandala.
    * Turner,_Ralph_Lilley (1969–1985), “kím”, inA Comparative Dictionary of
      the Indo-Aryan Languages, London: Oxford University Press
***** Newar[edit] *****
**** Etymology[edit] ****
Perhaps from Sanskrit कीट (kīṭa)
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * IPA(key): [kiː]
**** Noun[edit] ****
की • (kī) ? (Newa Spelling 𑐎𑐷)
   1. insect
